title: Cannot assign twice to immutable variable with `'l: while break 'l {}` as initializer

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
With:
```rust
fn _f() {
    let _x = 'label: while break 'label {};
}
```
we get:
```
warning[E0384]: cannot assign twice to immutable variable `_x`
 --> src/lib.rs:2:14
  |
2 |     let _x = 'label: while break 'label {};
  |         --   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cannot assign twice to immutable variable
  |         |
  |         first assignment to `_x`
  |         help: make this binding mutable: `mut _x`
  |
  = warning: this error has been downgraded to a warning for backwards compatibility with previous releases
  = warning: this represents potential undefined behavior in your code and this warning will become a hard error in the future
  = note: for more information, try `rustc --explain E0729`
```

This seems wrong. At least from a source view, `_x` is assigned to once.

Current MIR dump:

```rust
fn  _f() -> () {
    let mut _0: ();                      // return place in scope 0 at src/lib.rs:1:9: 1:9
    let _1: ();                          // "_x" in scope 0 at src/lib.rs:2:9: 2:11
    scope 1 {
    }

    bb0: {
        StorageLive(_1);                 // bb0[0]: scope 0 at src/lib.rs:2:9: 2:11
        StorageDead(_1);                 // bb0[1]: scope 0 at src/lib.rs:3:1: 3:2
        return;                          // bb0[2]: scope 0 at src/lib.rs:3:2: 3:2
    }
}
```

This might possibly be fixed by https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/61988.

cc @eddyb @pnkfelix @matthewjasper
